messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Perfecting our relationships instead of our child...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Kelly, Thanks for the reply and I m glad I shared this with you. Just so you know, I m Leslie from Sharon, MA :-) Leslie ... From: kbcdlovejo@aol.com To:
messages.messageBody:
Hi Kelly,

Thanks for the reply and I'm glad I shared this with you. Just so you know, I'm Leslie from Sharon, MA :-)

Leslie
----- Original Message -----
From: kbcdlovejo@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, September 13, 2004 12:52 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Perfecting our relationships instead of our child...


In a message dated 9/13/2004 1:52:52 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
slclsc@... writes:


When I saw you at the conference with Cameron (?) and I was priveliged to
witness him tenderly giving you a kiss as you knelt beside him before the close
of the conference, I was convinced that you had co-slept, nursed him til he
was 5 or whatever....I'm hoping that I will be as close to my kids as they
become teenagers, as you seem to be to Cameron.<<<<

Thanks. I guess we're just proof that you CAN heal what damage has been
done. He did sleep with us often, especially as an infant---but he also had a
crib and a stroller and nursed only to nine months. We've always had a good
relationship, and I don't think that he lost trust in me---even while in school.

Unschooling, by far, has been the best thing to happen to our family. I
can't imagine what would have happened had we not found unschooling. Traditional
same old same old, I guess. I wish others could experience what we have. THUS,
the conference! <G>

I'm glad you got to witness that, Sharon. And thanks for bringing it to my
attention. I read it to Cameron; he smiled! <G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] if not for unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/13/2004 1:00:43 PM Eastern Daylight Time, valerie@ubpub.com writes: Unschooling, by far, has been the best thing to happen to our family.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/13/2004 1:00:43 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
valerie@... writes:

Unschooling, by far, has been the best thing to happen to our
family. I can't imagine what would have happened had we not found
unschooling.

> ~Kelly

***** you'd just have a boring old minivan with no stickers. <g>

love, Valerie<<<

LOL. Thanks, Valerie!

If anyone has missed my *exciting* minivan, please look into the photos at
the _liveandlearnconference@yahoogroups.com_
(mailto:liveandlearnconference@yahoogroups.com)

~Kelly, conference diva and sticker queen! <G>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Perfecting our relationships instead of our child...
messages.msgSnippet: Kelly, When I saw you at the conference with Cameron (?) and I was priveliged to witness him tenderly giving you a kiss as you knelt beside him before the
messages.messageBody:
Kelly,

When I saw you at the conference with Cameron (?) and I was priveliged to witness him tenderly giving you a kiss as you knelt beside him before the close of the conference, I was convinced that you had co-slept, nursed him til he was 5 or whatever....I'm hoping that I will be as close to my kids as they become teenagers, as you seem to be to Cameron.

Leslie
Sharon, MA
Steven dh, Julia 8, James 4
----- Original Message -----
From: kbcdlovejo@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, September 09, 2004 3:30 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Perfecting our relationships instead of our child...


In a message dated 9/9/2004 3:13:55 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
mamaaj2000@... writes:

I think it was on the
AP-Discipline list that I learned the phrase "gentle words, gentle
touch" which have helped me a lot. I sound darn silly yelling that,
so it helps me calm down and reminds me to go over and model it. <<<<

What a wonderful phrase.

I'm SO sorry I missed the boat on the AP/LLL thang. Years and years of
traditional parenting just screw with you so much! I was one of the *nicer*
traditional parents, but NOTHING like this. Bummer.

As many say so often with unschooling, "Damn! I wish I'd learned about this
sooner!"

~Kelly, AP/LLL-less and starting "in the middle"




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
